titleStmt.title: Commonwealth of Kentucky v. Boon Hicks, Indictment
CWG6782

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
Marshall Circuit Court
The Commonwealth of Kentucky
Against
Boon Hicks.

The Grand jury of Marshall County in the name & by the authority of the Commonwealth of Kentucky accuse Boon Hicks of the crime of Grand Larceny committed as follows, (viz) the said Boon Hicks on the 26th day of June 1865 in the county aforesaid feloniously stole, took and carried away one mare the personal property of W. W. Reader of the value of more than four dollars against the peace and dignity of the Commonwealth of Kentucky

Information by
W. H. Raper
W. W. Reader
George Tucker
Malachi Cooper

A Copy, Attest:
C. C. Coulter clk

Bail fixed at Five Hundred Dollars for each Deft
C. S. Marshall judge

Commonwealth of Kentucky
against } Grand Larceny
Boon Hicks
Filed & bench warrant issued to McCracken July 1 1865
Test J. H. Riley clk
No 3~
A true bill
J. B. Dupriest
Bench wt. to Graves March 13. 1866.
A Copy attest;
C. C. Coulter clk.
